sen.j: 河井荃廬（かわい せんろ、男性、明治4年4月28日 (旧暦)（1871年6月15日） - 昭和20年（1945年）3月10日）は、近代日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Senro KAWAI (male, 15 June, 1871 - 10 March 1945) was a modern seal engraving artist.
Senro KAWAI (male, June 15, 1871 - March 10, 1945) was a modern Japanese seal engraving artist.
sen.cmt: June 15, March 10, に訂正しました。Japanese: 訳もれです。
sen.e: Senro KAWAI (male, June 15, 1871 - March 10, 1945) was a modern Japanese seal engraving artist.

sen.j: 中国に渡り呉昌碩に師事し、金石学に基づく篆刻を日本に啓蒙しその発展に尽くした。
sen.e: After moving to China and studying under Shoseki GO, he devoted himself to spreading seal engraving and its development
After moving to China and studying under Shoseki GO, he devoted himself to spreading seal engraving and its development
After moving to China and studying under Shoseki GO, he devoted himself to spreading seal engraving and its development

sen.j: 本来、姓は川井であったが戸籍の記帳ミスから河井となる。
sen.e: Although 川井 was his original last name, it was misspelled as 河井 when written in the birth certificate.
Although his original last name was written as 川井, it was misspelled as 河井 when written in the birth certificate.
sen.cmt: his original last name was written as という表現に改めました。
sen.e: Although his original last name was written as 川井, it was misspelled as 河井 when written in the birth certificate.

sen.j: 名は仙郎であるが、修して遷とも署した。
sen.e: His first name was Senro; however, he sometimes wrote the name Sen to shorten his name.
His first name was Senro; however, he sometimes wrote the name Sen to shorten his name.
His first name was Senro; however, he sometimes wrote the name Sen to shorten his name.

sen.j: 幼名は徳松、のちに師の篠田芥津の諱を避けて得松または得とした。
sen.e: His childhood name was spelled 徳松 (Tokumatsu) however later changed the spelling to 得松 (Tokumatsu) or 得 (Toku) in order to avoid overlapping with his teacher, Kaishin SHINODA's real name since it was considered rude.

His childhood name was spelled 徳松 (Tokumatsu) however later changed the spelling to 得松 (Tokumatsu) or 得 (Toku) in order to avoid overlapping with his teacher, Kaishin SHINODA's real name since it was considered rude.

His childhood name was spelled 徳松 (Tokumatsu) however later changed the spelling to 得松 (Tokumatsu) or 得 (Toku) in order to avoid overlapping with his teacher, Kaishin SHINODA's real name since it was considered rude.

sen.j: 号 (称号)は木僊、のちに荃楼、荃屢、荃廬と改号した。
sen.e: Bokusen was his original artist name yet later changed it to Seno, Senri and Senro.
sen.cmt: 荃楼を「せんおう」、荃屢を「せんり」と訳しました。
sen.e: Bokusen was his original artist name yet later changed it to Seno, Senri and Senro.
Bokusen was his original artist name yet later changed it to Seno, Senri and Senro.

sen.j: 別号に迂仙・蟫巣・九節丈人・知幻道人、号 (称号)に忘荃楼・忘荃屢・六不刻庵・継述堂・宝書龕などがある。
sen.e: His other artist names included Usen, 蟫巣, 九節丈人, Chigendojin, Boseno, Bosenri, 六不刻庵, Keijutsudo and Hoshodo.
sen.cmt: 蟫巣,九節丈人,六不刻庵の読みが不明でした。
sen.e: His other artist names included Usen, 蟫巣, 九節丈人, Chigendojin, Boseno, Bosenri, 六不刻庵, Keijutsudo and Hoshodo.
His other artist names included Usen, 蟫巣, 九節丈人, Chigendojin, Boseno, Bosenri, 六不刻庵, Keijutsudo and Hoshodo.

sen.j: 京都の人。
sen.e: He was from Kyoto.
He was from Kyoto.
He was from Kyoto.

sen.j: 京都寺町の腕利きの印判師として知られる川井仙右衛門の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the first son of Senemon KAWAI who was known as the skilled seal engraving artist in Kyotodera Village.
He was born as the first son of Senemon KAWAI who was known as the skilled seal engraving artist in Teramachi, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 京都寺町：用語集の訳に訂正しました。
sen.e: He was born as the first son of Senemon KAWAI who was known as the skilled seal engraving artist in Teramachi, Kyoto.

sen.j: 上京第30組小学校（現在の京都市立柳池中学校）に入学。
sen.e: He enterd the 30th Kamigyo Elementary School (now known as Kyoto Ryuchi Junior High School).
He enterd the 30th Kamigyo Elementary School (now known as Kyoto Ryuchi Junior High School).
He enterd the 30th Kamigyo Elementary School (now known as Kyoto Ryuchi Junior High School).

sen.j: 恩師神山鳳陽に教えを受け、また鳩居堂の熊谷直之と同窓となる。
sen.e: He had Hoyo GOYAMA as his teacher and became classmates with Naoyuki KUMAGAI whose family owned the Kyukyodo.
He had Hoyo GOYAMA as his teacher and became classmates with Naoyuki KUMAGAI whose family owned the Kyukyodo.
He had Hoyo GOYAMA as his teacher and became classmates with Naoyuki KUMAGAI whose family owned the Kyukyodo.

sen.j: 卒業後、林雙橋の元で漢詩を学び、20歳近くになって篠田芥津の門下となって篆刻を学ぶ。
sen.e: After graduation, he studied Chinese poetry under Sokyo HAYASHI and became Kaishin SHINODA's disciple to learn about seal engraving just before the age of 20,
After graduation, he studied Chinese poetry under Sokyo HAYASHI and became Kaishin SHINODA's disciple to learn about seal engraving just before the age of 20,
After graduation, he studied Chinese poetry under Sokyo HAYASHI and became Kaishin SHINODA's disciple to learn about seal engraving just before the age of 20,

sen.j: この頃、田中文求堂より金石書を入手し丹念に書写している。
sen.e: At around this time, he purchased an epigraphy book from the Tanaka Bunkyudo and practiced its style of writing.
At around this time, he purchased an epigraphy book from the Tanaka Bunkyudo and practiced its style of writing.
At around this time, he purchased an epigraphy book from the Tanaka Bunkyudo and practiced its style of writing.

sen.j: 数年後、師の勧めで同門の杉山雲津とともに篆刻の頒布会を作る。
sen.e: A few years later, Senro and Kumotsu SUGIYAMA established the distribution group of seal engravings with an advice from his teacher
A few years later, Senro and Kumotsu SUGIYAMA established the distribution group of seal engravings with an advice from his teacher
A few years later, Senro and Kumotsu SUGIYAMA established the distribution group of seal engravings with an advice from his teacher

sen.j: 27歳の頃、呉昌碩への敬慕が止まず手紙を送ると思わず昌碩の返信を受け取る。
sen.e: At the age of 27, Senro surprisingly received a replay when he sent a letter to Shoseki GO due to great respect towards him.
At the age of 27, Senro surprisingly received a replay when he sent a letter to Shoseki GO due to great respect towards him.
At the age of 27, Senro surprisingly received a replay when he sent a letter to Shoseki GO due to great respect towards him.

sen.j: 以降手紙による添削指導を受けるが、ますます清国への思いが募り、渡航費用を捻出する為に岐阜県に赴き、好事家の求めに応じて印を売っている。
sen.e: Although Shoseki gave him lessons in the letters, he developed even stronger desire to go to Qing, and therefore he went to Tottori Prefecture to sell his engravings to dilettantes in order to raise enough money to go to Qing.

Although Shoseki gave him lessons in the letters, he developed even stronger desire to go to Qing, and therefore he went to Gifu Prefecture to sell his engravings to dilettantes in order to raise enough money to go to Qing.
sen.cmt: Tottori ⇒ Gifu に訂正しました。
sen.e: Although Shoseki gave him lessons in the letters, he developed even stronger desire to go to Qing, and therefore he went to Gifu Prefecture to sell his engravings to dilettantes in order to raise enough money to go to Qing.

sen.j: 29歳のとき父が死去するが、家業は番頭に任せ自身は篆刻に没頭した。
sen.e: At the age of 29, despite of his father's death, he left his family business in a head clerk's hand and devoted himself to creating more art pieces.
At the age of 29, despite of his father's death, he left his family business in a head clerk's hand and devoted himself to creating more art pieces.
At the age of 29, despite of his father's death, he left his family business in a head clerk's hand and devoted himself to creating more art pieces.

sen.j: 30歳にて、ついに念願の清国渡航を実現し、上海市の昌碩と親しく交わっている。
sen.e: At the age of 30, he finally traveled to Qing and developed close bond with Shoseki in Shanghai City.
At the age of 30, he finally traveled to Qing and developed close bond with Shoseki in Shanghai City.
At the age of 30, he finally traveled to Qing and developed close bond with Shoseki in Shanghai City.

sen.j: このとき田中文求堂の田中慶太郎も同行している。
sen.e: Keitaro TANAKA from the Tanaka Bunkyudo went there with him.
Keitaro TANAKA from the Tanaka Bunkyudo went there with him.
Keitaro TANAKA from the Tanaka Bunkyudo went there with him.

sen.j: その後、毎年あるいは年に2回と渡航を繰り返し、中国の様々な文物を日本に持ち帰っている。
sen.e: He visited Qing once or twice every year after that and brought back various cultural products to Japan.
He visited Qing once or twice every year after that and brought back various cultural products to Japan.
He visited Qing once or twice every year after that and brought back various cultural products to Japan.

sen.j: その費用を賄う為にこの時期は生涯で最も盛んに篆刻し、人の求めに応じている。
sen.e: More seal engravings were produced than any other time in his life in order to raise enough money for the travel expenses.
More seal engravings were produced than any other time in his life in order to raise enough money for the travel expenses.
More seal engravings were produced than any other time in his life in order to raise enough money for the travel expenses.

sen.j: 中国でも羅振玉と汪康年より推薦文を貰い受け各地で売印をしている。
sen.e: After receiving a recommendation letter from Shingoku RA and Konen O, he began selling his works in various places in China.
After receiving a recommendation letter from Shingoku RA and Konen O, he began selling his works in various places in China.
After receiving a recommendation letter from Shingoku RA and Konen O, he began selling his works in various places in China.

sen.j: 明治36年（1903年）、京都の実家を弟の河井章石に譲り、東京下谷に転居し世帯を構えた。
sen.e: In 1903, he gave their parents' house to his younger brother Shoseki KAWAI and moved to Shitaya, Tokyo where he started a family.
In 1903, he gave their parents' house in Kyoto to his younger brother Shoseki KAWAI and moved to Shitaya, Tokyo where he started a family.
In 1903, he gave their parents' house in Kyoto to his younger brother Shoseki KAWAI and moved to Shitaya, Tokyo where he started a family.

sen.j: その後まもなく三井家（新町家9代）の庇護を受け、その邸内の簡素な家（九段富士見町）に移り住んだ。
sen.e: Not long after that, the Mitsuya family offered some support and let him live in a simple house (in Kudan Fujimicho) within their property.
Not long after that, the Mitsuya family offered some support and let him live in a simple house (in Kudan Fujimicho) within their property.
Not long after that, the Mitsuya family offered some support and let him live in a simple house (in Kudan Fujimicho) within their property.

sen.j: 荃廬は中国文物の目利きとなっていたので高堅の蒐集のアドバイザーともなった。
sen.e: Because he had developed an eye for Chinese cultural products, he became an advisor for art collectors.
Because he had developed an eye for Chinese cultural products, he became an advisor for art collectors.
Because he had developed an eye for Chinese cultural products, he became an advisor for art collectors.

sen.j: この頃、書家の巌谷一六から貫名菘翁の所蔵した法帖を譲り受けて、宝書龕の堂号を得ている。
sen.e: Around this time, a calligrapher Ichiroku IWAYA gave him the copybook printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy which had previously owned by Suo NUKINA and also offered the name Hoshogan
Around this time, a calligrapher Ichiroku IWAYA gave him the copybook printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy which had previously owned by Suo NUKINA and also offered the name Hoshogan
Around this time, a calligrapher Ichiroku IWAYA gave him the copybook printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy which had previously owned by Suo NUKINA and also offered the name Hoshogan

sen.j: 大正3年（1914年）、呉昌碩が初代社長となった西泠印社設立時の発起人の一人となり、結社後は長尾雨山とともに社員となった。
sen.e: In 1914, he was one of the promoters to start the company, Xilin Society of Seal Arts which welcomed Shoseki GO as the first president, and worked as an employee with Uzan NAGAO after the establishment.

In 1914, he was one of the promoters to start the company, Xilin Society of Seal Arts which welcomed Shoseki GO as the first president, and worked as an employee with Uzan NAGAO after the establishment.

In 1914, he was one of the promoters to start the company, Xilin Society of Seal Arts which welcomed Shoseki GO as the first president, and worked as an employee with Uzan NAGAO after the establishment.

sen.j: 設立メンバーのひとりである王禔の自用印は荃廬が刻している。
sen.e: One of the promoters, Shi O's seal was engraved by Senro.
One of the promoters, Shi O's seal was engraved by Senro.
One of the promoters, Shi O's seal was engraved by Senro.

sen.j: 昌碩との交流は彼が没する昭和2年まで続いた。
sen.e: His relationship with Shoseki lasted until Shoseki died in 1927.
His relationship with Shoseki lasted until Shoseki died in 1927.
His relationship with Shoseki lasted until Shoseki died in 1927.

sen.j: 因みに昭和6年、荃廬61歳のとき書道人の団体の代表となって渡航したが、これが最期の渡航となった。
sen.e: He made the last visit to China with the representative of calligraphers' association in 1931 when Senro was 61.
He made the last visit to China with the representative of calligraphers' association in 1931 when Senro was 61.
He made the last visit to China with the representative of calligraphers' association in 1931 when Senro was 61.

sen.j: 太平洋戦争末期、空襲が激しさを増しても居宅は皇居の近くだから爆撃されないと嘯き、戦禍を避けようとはしなかった。
sen.e: Even when the bombing became more intense during the last period of the Pacific War, he did not evacuate saying no bombs would drop near the Imperial Palace.
Even when the bombing became more intense during the last period of the Pacific War, he did not evacuate saying no bombs would drop near the Imperial Palace.
Even when the bombing became more intense during the last period of the Pacific War, he did not evacuate saying no bombs would drop near the Imperial Palace.

sen.j: しかし、昭和20年（1945年）3月10日、ついに爆撃に遭い、所蔵する膨大な書画や蔵書などとともに帰らぬ人となった。
sen.e: However, on March 10, 1945, he was killed due to aerial bombing, and his massive collection of calligraphic works and paintings as well as books were burnt down.
However, on March 10, 1945, he was killed due to aerial bombing, and his massive collection of calligraphic works and paintings as well as books were burnt down.
However, on March 10, 1945, he was killed due to aerial bombing, and his massive collection of calligraphic works and paintings as well as books were burnt down.

sen.j: 作風
sen.e: His Style of Work
His Style of Work
His Style of Work

sen.j: 篆刻の作風は年代とともに推移が激しい。
sen.e: His seal engraving style underwent constant change over the years.
His seal engraving style underwent constant change over the years.
His seal engraving style underwent constant change over the years.

sen.j: 20歳頃は師の篠田芥津の作風が色濃い。
sen.e: It was heavily influenced by his teacher Kaishin SHINODA's style when he was around the age of 20.
It was heavily influenced by his teacher Kaishin SHINODA's style when he was around the age of 20.
It was heavily influenced by his teacher Kaishin SHINODA's style when he was around the age of 20.

sen.j: 22歳ころには陳鴻寿風となる。
sen.e: It was influenced by Koju CHIN when he was around the age of 22.
It was influenced by Koju CHIN when he was around the age of 22.
It was influenced by Koju CHIN when he was around the age of 22.

sen.j: 26歳以降は作風が複雑に入り交じり徐三庚・呉昌碩など多様な影響がみえる。
sen.e: His style became complex after the age of 26 due to the influence from various artists like Sanko JO and Shoseki GO..
His style became complex after the age of 26 due to the influence from various artists like Sanko JO and Shoseki GO.
sen.cmt: ピリオドをひとつ削除しました。
sen.e: His style became complex after the age of 26 due to the influence from various artists like Sanko JO and Shoseki GO.

sen.j: 30歳は呉昌碩門下となったが、独自の作風も保ちつづけた。
sen.e: He kept his original style even after becoming a disciple of Shoseki GO at the age of 30.
He kept his original style even after becoming a disciple of Shoseki GO at the age of 30.
He kept his original style even after becoming a disciple of Shoseki GO at the age of 30.

sen.j: 六朝風の楷書を用いたのは荃廬が最初である。
sen.e: Senro was the first person to use the Rikucho style calligraphy.
Senro was the first person to use the Rikucho style calligraphy.
Senro was the first person to use the Rikucho style calligraphy.

sen.j: 中年以降、書も篆刻も制作を好まなくなったという。
sen.e: He rarely worked on seal engraving or calligraphy after his middle years..
He rarely worked on seal engraving or calligraphy after his middle years.
sen.cmt: ピリオドをひとつ削除しました。
sen.e: He rarely worked on seal engraving or calligraphy after his middle years.

sen.j: 納得いかない作品を後世に遺したくないという思いからである。
sen.e: It was because he did not want any random seal engravings, even the ones he was not entirely proud of, to be passed on to the nex generation to represent his skills as an artist.
It was because he did not want any random seal engravings, even the ones he was not entirely proud of, to be passed on to the nex generation to represent his skills as an artist.
It was because he did not want any random seal engravings, even the ones he was not entirely proud of, to be passed on to the nex generation to represent his skills as an artist.

sen.j: 満州国の国璽を要請されたときも体よく断っている。
sen.e: Even when he was asked to create a seal of state for Manchukuo, he politely turned down this request.
Even when he was asked to create a seal of state for Manchukuo, he politely turned down this request.
Even when he was asked to create a seal of state for Manchukuo, he politely turned down this request.

sen.j: 研究・業績
sen.e: His Research and Achievements
His Research and Achievements
His Research and Achievements

sen.j: 若いうちから金石学を非常に深く研究し、正しい印学を日本国内に広めることに務めた。
sen.e: He researched on epigraphy thoroughly from early on and devoted himself to spreading the accurate knowledge of seal engravings in Japan.
He researched on epigraphy thoroughly from early on and devoted himself to spreading the accurate knowledge of seal engravings in Japan.
He researched on epigraphy thoroughly from early on and devoted himself to spreading the accurate knowledge of seal engravings in Japan.

sen.j: 明治40年には初世中村蘭台、五世浜村蔵六、岡本椿所、山田寒山らと丁未印社を結ぶ。
sen.e: In 1907, he founded the Teibiinsha together with Randai NAKAMURA the first, Zoroku HAMAMURA the fifth, Chinsho OKAMOTO and Kanzan YAMADA.
In 1907, he founded the Teibiinsha together with Randai NAKAMURA the first, Zoroku HAMAMURA the fifth, Chinsho OKAMOTO and Kanzan YAMADA.
In 1907, he founded the Teibiinsha together with Randai NAKAMURA the first, Zoroku HAMAMURA the fifth, Chinsho OKAMOTO and Kanzan YAMADA.

sen.j: また日本新聞や朝日新聞に同志とともに篆刻の連載を持った。
sen.e: His seal engravings and his comrades' appeared serially in Nihon Shinbun and Asahi Shinbun.
His seal engravings and his comrades' appeared serially in Nihon Shinbun and Asahi Shinbun.
His seal engravings and his comrades' appeared serially in Nihon Shinbun and Asahi Shinbun.

sen.j: 特に日本新聞の連載では浜村蔵六とともに公募作品の選定を行い、評を行っている。
sen.e: Especially with Nihon Shinbun, he became the judge to select the impressions of seals which were sent from the public along with Zoroku HAMAMURA.
Especially with Nihon Shinbun, he became the judge to select seals which were sent from the public and make comments on them along with Zoroku HAMAMURA.
sen.cmt: select the impressions ⇒ select seals and make comments on them に訂正しました。
sen.e: Especially with Nihon Shinbun, he became the judge to select seals which were sent from the public and make comments on them along with Zoroku HAMAMURA.

sen.j: この印影と評は『日本印樷』として刊行された。
sen.e: Those seal impressions and their comments were published as a book called 'Nihon Inso'
Those seals and comments on them were published as a book called "Nihon Inso."
sen.cmt: seal impressions and their comments ⇒ seals and comments on them, ' ' ⇒ "." に訂正しました。
sen.e: Those seals and comments on them were published as a book called "Nihon Inso."

sen.j: 30年に亙る中国渡航の内に優れた書画や書籍を大量に収蔵した。
sen.e: While staying in China for 30 years, he collected many beautiful calligraphic works and paintings as well as books.
While visiting China frequently over the 30 years, he collected many beautiful calligraphic works and paintings as well as books.
sen.cmt: 30年に亙る中国渡航: ”30年間滞在していた” という英訳になっていたため、訂正しました。
sen.e: While visiting China frequently over the 30 years, he collected many beautiful calligraphic works and paintings as well as books.

sen.j: 書画は特に趙之謙を中心に名品を集め、昭和17年には趙之謙展を開催して国内に紹介している。
sen.e: He mainly collected Shiken CHO's calligraphic works and paintings and introduced his masterpieces to Japan by holding the Shiken CHO Exhibition in 1942
He mainly collected Shiken CHO's calligraphic works and paintings and introduced his masterpieces to Japan by holding the Shiken CHO Exhibition in 1942
He mainly collected Shiken CHO's calligraphic works and paintings and introduced his masterpieces to Japan by holding the Shiken CHO Exhibition in 1942

sen.j: 書籍は書画・金石・印譜などを膨大に収蔵したばかりでなく深い学識を得ていた。
sen.e: His collection of books was not just a massive collection of calligraphic works, epigraphs, and compilation of seal marks as he developed expert knowledge.
His collection of books was not just a massive collection of calligraphic works, epigraphs, and compilation of seal marks as he developed expert knowledge.
His collection of books was not just a massive collection of calligraphic works, epigraphs, and compilation of seal marks as he developed expert knowledge.

sen.j: 書道芸術においても自ら収蔵する名品法書のみならず、中村不折や三井家、羅振玉などの収蔵物を複製し出版した。
sen.e: There was not only his collection of the copybook printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy but also replicas of Fusetsu NAKAMURA, the Mitsui family and Shingyoku RA's collections in the book he published

There was not only his collection of the copybook printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy but also replicas of Fusetsu NAKAMURA, the Mitsui family and Shingyoku RA's collections in the books he published.
sen.cmt: books にしました。ピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: There was not only his collection of the copybook printed from the works of old masters of calligraphy but also replicas of Fusetsu NAKAMURA, the Mitsui family and Shingyoku RA's collections in the books he published.

sen.j: 印譜
sen.e: Compilation of Seal Marks
Compilation of Seal Marks
Compilation of Seal Marks

sen.j: 『日本印樷』山本雨石
sen.e: "Nihon Inso" by Useki YAMAMOTO
"Nihon Inso" by Useki YAMAMOTO
"Nihon Inso" by Useki YAMAMOTO

sen.j: 『忘荃屢印存』
sen.e: "Bosenri Inzon"
"Bosenri Inzon"
"Bosenri Inzon"

sen.j: 若年期に配布されたもの
sen.e: It was distributed in his youth.
It was distributed in his youth.
It was distributed in his youth.

sen.j: 『荃廬印存』植松香城編、昭和7年
sen.e: "Senro Inzon" edited by Kajo UEMATSU in 1932.
"Senro Inzon" edited by Kajo UEMATSU in 1932.
"Senro Inzon" edited by Kajo UEMATSU in 1932.

sen.j: 荃廬の許可なく勝手に刊行された
sen.e: It was published without the permission of Senro.
